SEARCH
Package org.example.controller

Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
org.example.controller.TaskManager
public class TaskManager extends Object
Manages tasks, categories, priority levels, and reminders. Provides functionalities for task CRUD operations, category and priority management, and data persistence using JSON.

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskManager

      public TaskManager()
      Constructs a new TaskManager instance. Initializes lists, loads data from JSON, and ensures default categories and priority levels.

  • Method Details

    • generateReminderId

      public int generateReminderId()
      Generates a unique ID for reminders.
      Returns:
      A new unique reminder ID.

    • addTask

      public void addTask(org.example.model.Task task)
      Adds a new task to the task list.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to be added.

    • updateTask

      public void updateTask(int id, String title, String description, String category, String priority, LocalDate deadline, String status)
      Updates an existing task with new details.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the task to update.
      title - The new title.
      description - The new description.
      category - The new category.
      priority - The new priority level.
      deadline - The new deadline.
      status - The new status.

    • deleteTask

      public void deleteTask(int id)
      Deletes a task based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the task to delete.

    • getAllTasks

      public List<org.example.model.Task> getAllTasks()
      Retrieves a list of all tasks.
      Returns:
      A list of all tasks.

    • getCategories

      public List<String> getCategories()
      Retrieves all available categories.
      Returns:
      A list of category names.

    • addCategory

      public boolean addCategory(String category)
      Adds a new category if it doesn't already exist.
      Parameters:
      category - The category name to add.
      Returns:
      True if the category was added, false if it already exists.

    • deleteCategory

      public void deleteCategory(String category)
      Deletes a category and removes associated tasks.
      Parameters:
      category - The category name to delete.

    • getPriorityLevels

      public List<String> getPriorityLevels()
      Retrieves all available priority levels.
      Returns:
      A list of priority levels.

    • addPriorityLevel

      public boolean addPriorityLevel(String priority)
      Adds a new priority level.
      Parameters:
      priority - The priority level to add.
      Returns:
      True if successfully added, false if it already exists.

    • deletePriorityLevel

      public void deletePriorityLevel(String priority)
      Deletes a priority level and updates tasks using it to "Default".
      Parameters:
      priority - The priority level to delete.

    • renameCategory

      public boolean renameCategory(String oldCategory, String newCategory)
      Renames an existing category in the task list. If the old category does not exist or the new category already exists, the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      oldCategory - The current name of the category to be renamed.
      newCategory - The new name to be assigned to the category.
      Returns:
      true if the category was successfully renamed, false otherwise.

    • renamePriority

      public boolean renamePriority(String oldPriority, String newPriority)
      Renames an existing priority level in the task list. If the old priority does not exist or the new priority already exists, the operation fails. The default priority level cannot be renamed.
      Parameters:
      oldPriority - The current name of the priority level to be renamed.
      newPriority - The new name to be assigned to the priority level.
      Returns:
      true if the priority was successfully renamed, false otherwise.

    • loadData

      public void loadData()
      Loads task data from a JSON file.

    • saveData

      public void saveData()
      Saves task data to a JSON file.

    • generateTaskId

      public int generateTaskId()
      Generates a unique ID for a new task.
      Returns:
      A new unique task ID.
